caption: Parc Monceau is a beautiful and peaceful oasis in the heart of Paris. The park is well-maintained, with lovely walking paths, picturesque bridges, and charming statues. Itâ€™s the perfect spot for a leisurely stroll, a quiet picnic, or just relaxing in nature. The park also has a playground for kids, making it great for families. I love the blend of nature and art here, with its tranquil ponds and historical architecture. A hidden gem away from the hustle and bustle of the city!

A short walk from our hotel is this nice little escape. Joggers, picnicking,  dog walking,  reading, walking, or just enjoying nature. There's a stand at one end to get water/coke or something to nibble.  I was very happy to get an almost sunny day.

Really nice park close to all the popular tourist spots. I pass through here each day and also used to live close by. The only problem with this park is that there is no dog space. It's absolutely insane and for the amount of people who have dogs in the dog they really need to cater for these people. Beautiful flowers and green area here. Also great place to run if you are looking for something quick - its just over a kilometre per loop.

Beautiful and colourful park. One of the entrance is just next to the metro. So easily you can commute. Itâ€™s a huge park where you can walk or run, come with your pets. There is one food stall inside the park too. In autumn it is more colourful.

Itâ€™s an exquisite and beautiful garden in Paris 8th arrondissement. Oh I hope I can lay down on its bench for just enjoying the slow sunset with such a beautiful view of flowers, the pond lake with the swans swimming, the water fountains and so many artsy statuesque.  The perfect weather just to enjoy this in between autumn and winter.
Stunning park, littered with arches, columns and statues. Perfect for people-watching while sipping on an afternoon coffee. The fall foliage was beautiful.  Parc Monceau is an oasis in the city.
A serene and picturesque garden, bursting with vibrant blooms, lush greenery, and trees and arcâ€”a perfect escape into nature's beauty

One of the smallest and beautiful gardens in Paris. A statue of Chopin is found here. A bridge and a pond with a semi circular columns make this a romantic and original park. The first parachuter in the world, Andre-Jacques Garnerin has a marker placed in this garden.

This such a lovely park. It is nice for a stroll. Many varieties of plants are in the gardens. The park is surrounded by mansions and other large buildings. As a semi-private park, the mansions have 24 hour access to the park. The park is ornamented with lakes, statues, and architectural features. Entry from Avenue Velazquez will take you through a magnificent gate.
Great parc. Note that all the special places are closed down. They are fixing the place and it only started in 2024. I guess it will take some years(?)

An absolutely enchanting place to spend your Saturday or Sunday downtime. Flowers blooming among marbled statues, slow strolls remind you to take your breath while you step. Benches serve you to pause and eat the savory crepe and espresso.
Went for a quick run during my stay in Paris and this park came across my way and did a few laps there. What a beautiful park it was, if you like running or walking dont miss out on this park.
Beautiful little park with lots of joggers and people doing yoga or working out. Lots of seating around the perimeter. Carousel for children. A small lake and bridge to take nice photos.
Like most Paris parks, this park barely tolerates dogs, the only exception I'm aware of is: Parc des Buttes-Chaumonts. I therefore won't give this park 5-stars, but it's a very nice park otherwise.
It's a beautiful parc, lots of places to picnic, a playground, a small lake and a nice carousel.
one of the best parks! itâ€™s not too small, not too big. accessible via metro and yet quiet. nice grass to lay and read, a lot of trees, a lake, just all around good park :)
Wonderful park with a great atmosphere, lots of benches and grass space to sit.  There is a vendor for refreshments too.  There are also a number of follies which make for interesting photos.
Serenity and peace. These two words are enough to define this beautiful park.
One of my favorite Paris parks  ..... and often filmed for movies!

Such a beautiful place to escape the city noise. The gardens are designed to bring a little bit of country into the city. With a kiosk and carousel, people were enjoying the spring sunshine. They sang about Paris in the Spring and it is so true!
This time the park is busy due to Olympics, beautiful well taken care of, you can relax efter your sightseeing/ breakfast in the park. Your choice
beautiful park , very big and animal friendly. you can chill on the grass and enjoy coffee at the little kiosk

A beautiful park in Paris. Lovely pond with a bridge across it and ducks swimming around, Roman columns and statues add character. Plenty of bench seating and a vibrant place with people of all ages enjoying the environment. A lovely place for a relaxing walk or brisker jog.
A quaint public park in Parisâ€™ 8th Arrondisement. Has a water body, a bridge beautiful greenery and ample seating benches. Great for casual strolls and family outings.
Gorgeous park and setting for a walk, run or just to watch the world go by and have a picnic
A very beautiful park where you can simply escape from the big city. Just enjoy and say thank you to nature.

The very best place to have a walk with family on Sundays. There's everything you might need  for an active rest. Play yard for the kids, carousel ðŸŽ , green lawns and a lot of trees which are giving the blessed shadow. Definitely recommend for a family weekend stroll â€¦
Beautiful little park. Very enjoyable.

This is a very beautiful and pleasant park for walking.  in one you can do exercises or go in for sports, in the other you can take a walk with your child, there are many benches everywhere to sit.  there is a pond with ducks.  landscaping. very clean and in summer you can have a picnic on the green grass.  you can't walk with dogs in the park, but sometimes people come with dogs until the park guard notices them and asks them to leave.  children ride in this park on ponies and horses.  and also in this park there are interesting monuments, one of them is the first parachute descent in the world, which took place in this park.  if you want to relax in an oasis of nature or do an easy jog.  play with kids or friends.  make a picnic then this park will suit you

Parc de Monceau is a theme park located in the Europe district in the 8th arrondissement of Paris.  The garden is beautiful and the spaces are well maintained. There are benches and the possibility of sitting on the grass, a beautiful pond decorated with Roman columns and a willow tree, a play area in addition to many shaded areas. A romantic and family garden offering very interesting decorative elements. This garden can be an inspiration for artists and ordinary people.

A park that was built in 1778!  Peaceful and lovely park, surrounded by magnificient architecture and botanics. Had a wonderful evening strolling in the park. Truly a great experience when I visitted Paris.  Parc Monceau includes statues of famous French figures including Guy de Maupassant, FrÃ©dÃ©ric Chopin, Charles Gounod, Ambroise Thomas, Alfred de Musset, and Edouard Pailleron. Today, the park has play areas for children and remains very popular with local residents and their families.

This enchanting Parisian park isn't just a serene retreat; it's also a perfect setting for a delightful picnic. Picture spreading out a blanket beside the serene pond, indulging in wine, cheese, and a crusty French baguette amidst the Roman columns and statues, adding a touch of gastronomic delight to your relaxing day in this picturesque oasis.

A very nice park full of green, trees, benches, a pond with ducks, lots of wildlife, a carousel for kids and ancient styled buildings and statues. Near the Arc de Triomphe, very close to the metro station, it's a wonderful place to visit and chill by the pond with the ducks, or enjoy a freshly made sweet crepe at the benches underneath the trees.
Very comfortable place for relaxing and enjoying the weather day.  Good for walking ðŸš¶ around the park and chilling with a book ðŸ“– to read. â€¦
Absolute gem of a part. Quiet place in a middle of busy streets. First time I have ever seen a partridge in a park!
Lovely park, with plenty of paved trails, lined with benches to sit and relax, shady areas for groups to workout, picnic, there are statues and a playgroundâ€¦. So glad I visited.

Beautiful, full of wonderfully floral fragrances. Mix of permanent sculptures and classic artistic structures, as well as relatively temporary installations (such as a cute Smurf village). Important for your planning: the police are very serious about the closing time of the park. They start riding their bikes around and blowing whistles and yelling for people to head toward the exit around 5-10 minutes before the closing time and (relatively nicely) chase everyone out to be able to lock the gates on time.

Parc Monceau in Paris is indeed a beautiful park nestled in the heart of the city. With its enchanting landscape and elegant features, it offers a serene and picturesque retreat for visitors and locals alike. The park's romantic atmosphere, adorned with statues, fountains, and a charming lake, creates a truly captivating ambiance. Its lush greenery and well-manicured gardens provide a peaceful oasis where one can relax, take a leisurely stroll, or simply soak in the beauty of nature. Parc Monceau is a delightful gem that showcases the timeless allure of Paris.
